gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Water Quality Monitoring and Data Summaries Indiana, Derived from EPA BASINS: Indiana, 2004

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: WATER_QUALITY_STATISTICS_EPA_IN is a point shapefile developed by the USEPA BASINS 3.0 program and edited by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates. Points represent monitoring stations attributed as occurring within the state of Indiana or along the Ohio River in Kentucky and Ohio. Joinable tables must be utilized to access data at specific stations for specific parameters. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - This data set provides statistical summaries of water quality monitoring for 47 physical and chemical-related parameters. The parameter specific statistics were computed by station for 5-year intervals from 1970 to 1994 and a three year interval from 1995 to 1997. The data are extracted from the U.S. EPA Storage and Retrieval of US Waters Parametric Data (STORET) which is contributed by a number of organizations including federal, state, interstate agencies, universities, contractors, individuals and water laboratories. Data updates are performed weekly. Each provider of data is responsible for the data it submits to STORET. For distribution with BASINS v.2.0, the spatial attributes of the database were prepared in Arcview shape file format while selected relational attributes were prepared in Arcview DBF file format.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To provide general information on water quality statistics at monitoring stations in Indiana. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "The STORET database serves as a repository of waterway parametric data, including information on ambient, intensive survey, effluent and biological water quality." "Intended use of data: This data set was prepared to support the U.S. EPA BASINS (Better Assessment Science Integrating Point and Nonpoint Sources) System.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data is from the USEPA, BASINS 3.0.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This is a small scale national database and positional error does exist. Use should be limited to broad planning and information, however, completeness and horizontal position issues prohibit this digital file from replacing field review for final decision making. This data set was compiled by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "NONE" CREDIT Please acknowledge USEPA. The data was developed by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency as part of BASINS 3.0

No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY The product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: This dataset, as well as many others, was compiled for mapping and download as part of the Indiana Statewide GIS Database funded by the Indiana Department of Transportation. Many publicly available datasets were created, edited, and compiled inclusion in the Statewide Database Website where users can download data or map online using ArcIMS. Many public data sources, not created in conjunction with the statewide project, were obtained by website download, contacting originators, and creating spatial files from tabular data. A range of layer editing was used, specific to each layer, from full creation, to data cleaning, to only reformatting metadata. The level of editing done by BLA or IGS is fully disclosed in the process steps of this metadata; credit for the information is retained by the originator.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata. It is possible that multiple points occur concurrently at the same location.
The monitoring stations included in this file are subset of the national dataset consisting of stations listed as occurring in Indiana and along the Ohio River in Kentucky and Ohio.
No information was included in original BASINS 3.0 metadata.
Observing positional accuracy suggests that this layer is best used at smaller scales.
No information was included in the original BASINS 3.0 metadata. Vertical accuracy does not appear to be a factor in the digital production of the data set.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: US Environmental Protection Agency BASINS metadata reports - "The BASINS Water Quality Monitoring and Data Summaries for the conterminous U.S. are created by retrieving the source data from the STORET database using the STORET MEAN program. Monitoring stations characterized as ambient stream, lake, reservoir, canal, estuary or ocean were selected. Summary statistics were computed by the program by station for 5-year intervals from 1970-1994 and for the period from 1995-1997. Statistics include number of observations, standard deviation, mean, 15th, 25th, 50th, 75th and 85th percentiles. A BASINS water quality station ID was assigned to each station in order to facilitate links and joins within BASINS between station data and the monitoring data summary. For distribution with BASINS v2.0, ARCVIEW shapefiles which included the spatial extent of each of the ten U.S. EPA Regions, plus the 8-digit hydrologic units that crossed region boundaries were prepared to indicate the geographic locations of the monitoring stations within the region."

A file named "WQ_STAT" was obtained by Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates from the USEPA BASINS 3.0 Region 5 CD, <http://www.epa.gov/OST/BASINS/>. The file was selected to points attributed as being in Indiana and transformed from Geographic to UTM, Zone 16, meters. Some empty fields were deleted.

The Metadata provided by the orignator to accompany the unedited data obtained by BLA, was used to create the FGDC compliant metadata which accompanies this file. Information from orignial metadata was used to fill the fields in the FGDC form and other information regarding any edits made by BLA to the original file are documented. Because information in this metadata is provided by the originator, occasionally, field information may not comply with FGDC field definitions, although the overall form is FGDC compliant. Errors are corrected when possible, but if doubt exists the field was populated by whatever information was provided by the orignator. Fields where errors have been more frequent include Data Quality Information and Entity and Attribute Information.

The Attribute information has been altered from the original. The original Enumerated_Domain values provided no value to the corresponding table(s). A Glossary of Terms was downloaded from the EPA website (http://www.epa.gov./storpub/legacy/glossary.htm) and used to yield a more intuitive description of each Enumerated_Domain of each corresponding Attribute.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit. v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.
All information was obtained from the source data.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
